summary: The document is a CIA memorandum responding to a request from the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) for depositions and interviews of specific individuals as part of their investigation. Initially made verbally on June 1, 1978, the request was later formalized in writing. The memorandum details the individuals requested, the CIA's procedural handling of the request, and notes compliance with the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992 by not objecting to the release of certain information.
key_findings: The HSCA sought depositions and interviews with specific CIA personnel for their investigation.
A verbal request was made on June 1, 1978, followed by a formal written request.
The CIA demonstrated compliance by not opposing the release of certain information under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
The memorandum outlines internal CIA procedures for processing such requests, including detailed distribution instructions.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
